abstract: If the $35 billion contract for aerial refueling tankers were split between rivals, Louis Gallois of EADS says his team would need a commitment for at least 12 planes.
snippet: If the $35 billion contract for aerial refueling tankers were split between rivals, Louis Gallois of EADS says his team would need a commitment for at least 12 planes.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The chief executive of Europe’s largest aerospace company said Thursday that it would probably bid on a $35 billion contract for aerial refueling tankers even if the Pentagon decided to split the pact between bidders.

headline.main: EADS Willing to Consider Splitting Air Force Tanker Contract With Boeing
headline.print_headline: EADS Would Participate In Further Tanker Bids

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
